summary: SENB ENB Manager is quite literally what the title suggests: a utility to make installing, organizing, and testing ENB's 100x easier.
descriptionHtml:
[b][font=Arial][size=5][u]Retired.[/u]

SENB ENB Manager is quite literally what the title suggests: a utility to make installing, organizing, and testing ENBs 100x easier.[/size]

[/font][/b]I made this program with two main goals in mind: usability and visual prowess. I wouldn't have been able to do it without IgnaceMaes [url=https://github.com/IgnaceMaes/MaterialSkin]MaterialSkin[/url], and Viki4Tech's[url=https://github.com/Viki4Tech/MaterialDesign] Lollipop WinForms UI[/url], huge thanks to them both. 

To use this program, you must first have version 4.5 of the .NET Framework, which will be available to download here - although most of you guys should have this already installed. 

To start, make sure that the MaterialSkin.dll is in the same directory as the SENB ENB Manager executable. 
[size=3]
[b]Saving and installing an ENB Preset[/b][/size]

[list=1]
[*] Run the program. 
[*] Set the Skyrim/Fallout and Script Extender directories in the [u]Settings[/u] tab. The script extender path is not necessary if you do not have one. 
[*] Install an ENB into your Game directory. If you do not know how to do this, follow [url=http://wiki.step-project.com/Guide:ENB]this S.T.E.P. guide[/url].
[*] Navigate to the [u]Save Enb Preset[/u] tab, and choose a name for your ENB preset. This can be anything you want, but any presets with matching names shall be overwritten. To finish, select the [u]Save Enb Preset[/u] button. The ENB files from your game directory with be MOVED into your preset folder. Said folder shall be located in "/data/Presets/".
[*] To install a Preset, navigate to the [u]Install Enb Preset[/u] tab. Select the ENB Preset you want to install from the list of Radio buttons. If your ENB preset does not show up on the list, restart the program. With your chosen preset, select the [u]Install ENB Preset[/u] button.
[*] A dialog window should show up with a list of the preset's files. Here, you can select the files you want to move into the game directory. You can also right-click the file name to open it. After you have chosen the files you want to install, select [u]Install[/u]. The program will COPY the preset files into the game directory. [b][u]This will REMOVE all current ENB files in the game directory. [/u][/b]
[*] [size=2]Profit! The ENB is now installed into the game directory. In the next segment, I will go into depth on the "Cleaning" of the game directory, and the removal of your presets.[/size]
[/list][size=3]
[b]"Cleaning" the game directory, and removing ENB presets[/b][/size]

[list=1]
[*] To clean the game directory, you can select either the [u]Clean Game Directory[/u] button located in the [u]Save Enb Preset[/u] tab, or you can select the [u]Uninstall Enb Files[/u] located in the [u]Install Enb Preset[/u] tab.[b] This will remove ALL ENB files from the game directory. [/b]
[*] To delete a preset, navigate to the [u]Install Enb Preset[/u] tab, and select the ENB preset you would like to remove. After you have chosen the preset to remove, select the [u]Delete Enb Preset[/u] button, which will then delete the preset file from "/data/Presets/", and repopulate the radio buttons. 
[/list][size=3]
[b]Other notes[/b][/size]
In the [u]Settings[/u] tab, there is a button with the name: [u]Update enbfilter.cfg[/u], which is a list of EVERY ENB file that I could think of at the time. If you come across any ENB files left behind by the program, select said button, would will download a new version of the file. If this still does not work, put the name of the file in the list, and then post it on this page. 

[b][u]UPDATE NOTES[/u]
[b]
[b][b][b][b]Version 1.6.3
[list]
[*]Fixed any issues regarding C# 6
[/list][/b][/b][/b][/b][/b][b]
[b]Version 1.6.2
[list]
[*]Fixed issues regarding the archive, should work 100%!
[/list][/b][/b]
[b]Version 1.6.1
[list]
[*]Stability improvements, as well as UI changes
[/list][/b]
Version 1.5
[list]
[*]UI Updates thanks to [url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/user/2503898-neokio/]neokio[/url]
[/list]
Version 1.4.1
[list]
[*]I feel like an idiot. I pushed the new version without actually testing the app. The Install Preset button actually works now. 
[/list]
[size=2]Version 1.4[/size]
[list]
[*][size=1]Added support for an unlimited amount of presets[/size]
[*]The program will automatically generate meta file directories
[*]The Install Preset tab is now default
[/list]
[/b][b]Version 1.2[/b]
[list]
[*]Performance and Stability enhancements
[*]Embedded the MaterialSkin.dll into the exe
[/list]
author: Metherul
